database.name: massive
database.description: The Massive Database contains information about all the proteomics/metabolomics datasets in massive

entry.name: Proteomics Studies of the Interactome of RNA Polymerase II C-Terminal Repeated Domain
entry.description: We developed a proteomics approach to examine the mammalian CTD-interactome. We used six synthetic peptides each consisting of four consensus CTD-repeats and with different combinations of serine and tyrosine phosphorylation as affinity-matrix to pull-down nuclear proteins from HeLa cells. The pull-down fractions were then analyzed by MUDPIT mass spectrometry. This approach identified a total of 100 CTD-interacting proteins pull-downed by the differentially phosphorylated CTD-peptides. Our analyses showed that the majority of proteins pulled-down by serine-phosphorylatd CTD are involved in RNA processing. Furthermore, this study identified proteins that were preferentially pulled-down by tyrosine/serine-doubly phosphorylated CTD.

additional_fields.field: ABL, Ionizing Radiation, MUDPIT, Phosphotyrosine, pY1-CTD antibodies, RPRD1B
